data.text: @poppywillowgirl @rachaellehr Yes Jo, fortunately the platform that the school uses has this I built facility.

@rachaellehr @RayBoyd007 Yes when I was at LSHS we had an IEC and about the same number of languages. Huge task but essential to get it right for families. Our EEAs were essential. Great that tech can assist this.
@poppywillowgirl @RayBoyd007 The translation can be a bit hit and miss, but it’s better than nothing ☺️

@poppywillowgirl @RayBoyd007 In the interest of getting communications out quickly to ensure families know their child needs to isolate, we rely on Seesaw as it translates into the home language on the family member’s device (more than 55 languages). We have a wide range of languages spoken at WBPS.
@rachaellehr @RayBoyd007 Has DoE provided documentation in a range of languages? If not this is something to ask for.
@RayBoyd007 I think it’s just getting started 😐 https://t.co/cpWTkwMtuU
@rachaellehr I hope things settle for you and the team

@RayBoyd007 With over half of families being EALD it adds an extra layer of challenge in communicating requirements. That said, I am so thankful for Seesaw. It’s made things way easier as it translates ☺️
